name: Barbados
description: Barbados, officially the Barbados Island Territory, is a stunning coral island nation located in the southeastern Caribbean Sea. Known for its pristine beaches, vibrant culture, and rich history, Barbados offers a unique blend of relaxation, adventure, and cultural experiences. The island boasts a diverse landscape, ranging from rolling hills and lush sugarcane fields to dramatic coastlines and underwater reefs.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The historic capital of Barbados, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
quickFacts.detail: Bridgetown is a bustling port city with colonial architecture and a lively atmosphere.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population of Barbados is approximately 282,000.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population is of African descent, with significant British and other Caribbean influences.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Barbados is a relatively small island nation.
quickFacts.detail: It’s the easternmost island of the Caribbean chain.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The BBD is pegged to the US Dollar at a rate of 2:1.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: English is the official language of Barbados.
quickFacts.detail: However, a variety of Creole dialects are widely spoken.

quickFacts.label: Independence
quickFacts.description: Barbados gained independence from the United Kingdom.

climateData.title: Tropical Climate
climateData.description: Barbados enjoys a tropical climate with consistently warm temperatures and high humidity throughout the year. The island experiences two main seasons: the dry season (December to April) and the wet season (May to November).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season is characterized by sunny skies, low humidity, and minimal rainfall. It’s the most popular time to visit Barbados.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season brings increased rainfall, particularly in the afternoons. However, showers are typically short-lived, and the island remains warm and sunny.

naturalWonders.name: Harrison's Cave
naturalWonders.description: Harrison's Cave is a spectacular subterranean cave system filled with stunning stalactites, stalagmites, and underground streams. It’s a truly unforgettable experience.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The cave was formed over millions of years by the flow of groundwater through limestone. Guided tours take visitors through a series of chambers and passages, showcasing the cave's incredible beauty.

naturalWonders.name: Bathsheba
naturalWonders.description: Bathsheba is a dramatic and rugged coastline on the eastern end of Barbados, known for its powerful waves and stunning rock formations.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The area is a popular spot for surfing and offers breathtaking views of the Atlantic Ocean. The sea stacks, known as 'The Alley', are a particularly iconic feature.

ecosystemData.title: Barbados Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Barbados boasts a diverse range of ecosystems, including coral reefs, mangrove forests, seagrass beds, and dry forests. These ecosystems support a rich variety of plant and animal life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: Barbados’ coral reefs are home to a vast array of marine life, including colorful fish, sea turtles, and dolphins.

statistics.details: Diverse coral species contribute to the reef's health.
A wide variety of fish inhabit the reefs.

notableSpecies.name: Loggerhead Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: A key indicator of reef health.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forest Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: Barbados’ dry forests are home to a unique collection of trees and plants adapted to the island’s dry climate.

statistics.details: Many endemic species are found in the dry forests.

notableSpecies.name: Barbados Red Mango
notableSpecies.significance: A unique tree species found only in Barbados.

notableSpecies.name: Yellow Warbler
notableSpecies.significance: A migratory bird that breeds in Barbados.

activities.title: Barbados Activities
activities.description: Barbados offers a wide range of activities for visitors of all interests and abilities.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Barbados’ scenic trails and discover hidden waterfalls.

activities.name: Hamoa Trail Hike
activities.description: A popular hike through the Welchman Hall Gully, showcasing stunning tropical vegetation.

activities.name: Morris Bay Trail
activities.description: A challenging hike through the interior of the island, offering panoramic views.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, plenty of water, insect repellent

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the crystal-clear waters of Barbados with a variety of water sports.

activities.name: Scuba Diving
activities.description: Explore Barbados’ vibrant coral reefs and encounter diverse marine life.

activities.name: Surfing
activities.description: Catch the waves at Bathsheba or Accra Beach.

equipment.hiking: Sturdy hiking boots, backpack, water bottle
